intro: Tontelea longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved tontelea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, spherical berries. Tontelea longifolia is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforest understory.
